result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke O. Sherrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Luke O. Sherrow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Luke O. Sherrow was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $300  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100 ea applicable count).   
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided)  and pay surcharge.     
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with Callina W w/o permission of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke O. Sherrow

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:10am-  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions - consecutive to 06CF36.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs, DV surcahrge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:41am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
Due to time constraints, 4/1/2015 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 6/12/2015 at 10am.  Matter is resolved.  Parties notified in court.

Defendant Luke O. Sherrow appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time as DE is facing revocation in another matter.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:45am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Barth is requesting an adjournment.  DE has a revocation hearing scheduled in 06CF36 for next week.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
Notice of Assignment of Judge returned for Luke O Sherrow.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
